Package com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.screens

Class LevelScreen

java.lang.Object
com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.screens.levels.LevelScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOneScreen
public abstract class LevelScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen, com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
Abstract class which acts as a base class for all level screens. Each individual level class extends this class and defines properties such as the player, enemies, houses & static sprites etc.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    LevelScreen​(GigabitEconomy director, java.lang.String backgroundTexturePng, java.lang.String levelMusic)
    A template constructor for use by all level screen subclasses.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelScreen

      public LevelScreen​(GigabitEconomy director, java.lang.String backgroundTexturePng, java.lang.String levelMusic)
      A template constructor for use by all level screen subclasses. Sets properties that differ between levels such as game director & background texture.
      Parameters:
      director - the instance of the game director
      backgroundTexture - the background graphic png of the level

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player player)
      Add a Player to the level. If level already has a Player, as a level can only have one, it'll be overridden.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to be added to the level

    • addEnemies

      public void addEnemies​(java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> enemies)
      Add Enemies to the level. Any passed Enemies will be added to the list of existing Enemies already added.
      Parameters:
      enemies - an ArrayList of enemies to be added

    • addParcelVan

      public void addParcelVan​(ParcelVan parcelVan)
      Add a Parcel Van to the level. If level already has a Parcel Van, as a level can only have one, it'll be overridden.
      Parameters:
      parcelVan - the Parcel Van to be added to the level

    • addSprites

      public void addSprites​(java.util.ArrayList<? extends TiledObject>... objArr)
      Adds ArrayList(s) of sprites to the level, instantiating them with the Tile Manager
      Parameters:
      objArr - ArrayList(s) containing sprites (TiledObjects) - in priority order

    • addSprite

      public void addSprite​(TiledObject sprite)
      Add a sprite (TiledObject) to the level
      Parameters:
      sprite - the TiledObject representing the sprite

    • removeSprite

      public void removeSprite​(TiledObject sprite)
      Remove a sprite (TiledObject) from the level
      Parameters:
      sprite - the TiledObject (sprite) to be removed

    • show

      public void show()
      Initialises the sprite batch (which contains all character sprites) and adds the player/enemy characters to it. Called by LibGDX when the screen is set as active by the game director.
      Specified by:
      show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    • render

      public void render​(float delta)
      Sets the current view of the screen, drawing sprites on the screen based on their current position; also calls the player collision check system to check for any collisions since the previous render. Called by LibGDX upon each render of the screen.
      Specified by:
      render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
      Parameters:
      delta - the time elapsed since the previous render (in seconds)

    • showErrorText

      public void showErrorText​(java.lang.String error)
      Show an error message to the user
      Parameters:
      error - the error message

    • getTileManager

      public TileManager getTileManager()
      Get the level's TileManager instance
      Returns:
      the level's TileManager instance

    • getHouses

      public java.util.ArrayList<House> getHouses()
      Get the level's Houses
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all the level's Houses

    • getParcelVan

      public ParcelVan getParcelVan()
      Get the level's player van
      Returns:
      the level's PlayerVan

    • getParcels

      Get the number of parcels remaining to be collected in the level

      number of parcels remaining in level

      public void complete()
      Complete the level (called when the level is complete i.e. the final parcel is delivered)

    • hide

      public void hide()
      Sets the input processor to null to prevent the Player's application listener from listening to user inputs; then calls dispose() to remove the screen's assets from memory. Called by LibGDX when the screen is made inactive.
      Specified by:
      hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Removes the screen's assets (background texture, sprite batch and moving sprites) from memory when the screen is made inactive and they're therefore no longer needed. Called by hide().
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
